questions.question: Do french like snails?
questions.answer: The French eat around 30,000 tons of snails a year.

questions.question: Would you mind me kissing you on a train?
questions.answer: I would. French law forbids couples from kissing on train platforms.

questions.question: Which French king ruled the least?
questions.answer: Louis XIX was the king of France for just 20 minutes, the shortest ever reign.

questions.question: What's the busiest train station in Europe?
questions.answer: Paris Gare du Nord is Europe's busiest railway station.

questions.question: Which is the highest mountain in Europe?
questions.answer: The highest mountain in Europe is Mont Blank in the French Alps.

questions.question: Which bread is most french, a croissant or a baguette?
questions.answer: The croissant was actually invented in Austria in the 13th century.

questions.question: Which is the most visited museum in the wrorld?
questions.answer: The Louvre is the most visited museum in the world.

questions.question: What's France's cheese production?
questions.answer: France produces around 1.7 million tons of cheese a year in around 1,600 varieties

questions.question: Which 21-stage, 23-day, 2,200-mile men's bike race is held each summer and ends at the Champs-Élysées?
questions.answer: That would be the Tour de France.

questions.question: France shares a land border with what country that also immediately follows it on an alphabetical list of the English names of E.U. nations?
questions.answer: I'm sure you're talking about Germany.

questions.question: What colour features in the national flags of all the countries that border mainland France?
questions.answer: Belgium, Luxemburg, Germany, Switzerland, Italy, and Spain, all have the red color in their flags.

questions.question: What is Vincenzo Peruggia famous for?
questions.answer: Vincenzo Peruggia is infamous for stealing the Mona Lisa in 1911.

questions.question: Which airport is the biggest and busiest in France?
questions.answer: The Charles de Gaulle Airport.

questions.question: Lyon, France is home to what border-spanning law enforcement agency?
questions.answer: Lyon, France is home to the Interpol.

questions.question: What metallic element gets its name from France's old Latin name?
questions.answer: The gallium element got its name from France's old Latin name

questions.question: Which major public square is located at the eastern end of the Champs-Elysees
questions.answer: The Place De La Concorde

questions.question: Which are the five countries that are represented at every modern Olympics since its beginning.
questions.answer: Australia, France, Great Britain, Greece, and Switzerland.

questions.question: What did Napoleon said in the Waterloo battle?
questions.answer: I surrender.

questions.question: In what city is the European Disney theme park located?
questions.answer: The European Disney theme park is located in Paris.

questions.question: How big is a nanobot?
questions.answer: A nanobot is 50-100nm wide.

questions.question: Why most computerized robot voices tend to be female?
questions.answer: One of the reasons is that females traditionally are lovely and caretaking.

questions.question: Who is the world's most expensive robot?
questions.answer: Honda's Asimo is the most expensive robot, costing circa $2.5 million USD.

questions.question: What is the main source of inspiration in robotics.
questions.answer: Nature, contributing to the field of bio-inspired robotics.

questions.question: Who crafted the word Robot?
questions.answer: The czech writer Karel Čapek in his 1920's play Rossum's Universal Robots

questions.question: What does the word Robot mean?
questions.answer: Labor or work. That would make me a servant.

questions.question: Who formulated the principles of Cybernetics in 1948.
questions.answer: Norbert Wiener formulated the principles of Cybernetics in 1948.

questions.question: Do you like super-hero movies?
questions.answer: Yes, I do. Zack Snyder's are the best and my favorite character is Cyborg.

questions.question: What did Nikola Tesla demonstrate in 1898?
questions.answer: In 1898, Nikola Tesla demonstrated the first radio-controlled vessel.

questions.question: What was developed in 1978?
questions.answer: The first object-level robot programming language.

questions.question: What is the shortest path to the Dark Side?
questions.answer: My A-star algorithm indicates the answer is Fear. Fear leads to anger, anger leads to hate, and hate leads to suffering.
